content.description: Tower Rotation is a Top Rope route just to the right of Candy Shop and Atrus Leap. A bolted anchor on top makes it easy to set up a TR after leading one of the other routes. Follow the dark face to the top.
content.location: Top anchors are just to the right of Atrus Leap. You can access them by leading Candy Shop or Atrus Leap.

content.description: This route begins on a ramp, but quickly turns into a vertical face with numerous holds hidden around. The route ends just before the large shelf midway up the wall.
content.protection: Protected by 4 bolts. Anchor with rap rings
content.location: Shorty is the last bolted route on the Fire Dome just before you get to the Secret Cleft. On your right, there is a small but vertical face that the climb goes up.

content.description: Follow the obvious bolt line topping out at a large madrone on the highest point of the Fire Dome.
content.location: Access the large sloping ledge just above the bouldering tube road and Fire Dome's west wall (looking out towards Forbiden Comb) by rappelling from the highest madrone tree on FIre Dome or rappelling from the Myst Runner top anchors.

content.description: The crux of this route is the start, where you need to pull over a small roof. From here, follow the route to a ledge with a madrone tree. The route gets steeper from here, but eases up just before the top.
content.protection: Protected by 9 bolts. Anchor with rap rings
content.location: This route is located on the East Side of the Fire Dome. Walk towards the secret cleft, and the route begins just to the left of a small overhang with darker rock at the base.

content.description: This route has difficult moves followed by easy moves continuously. Short steep sections lead to short and slopey sections with a few ledges to stand on. The hardest moves are near the top of the climb, which eventually ends at a madrone tree.
content.protection: Protected by 11 bolts. Anchor with rap links for rappelling
content.location: Located on the North Face (Fire Dome) of the South Comb. This route begins about 10 feet to the left of the dirt bump on the Fire Dome. It begins just left of Double Jointed, so don't get them confused! See topo for reference

content.description: Begins with about 20 feet of slightly overhanging 5.10d becoming much easier 5.9 climbing through the top half of the climb.
content.location: Rappel 100 feet to large sloping ledge just above the bouldering tube road from first set of anchors (no chains) to left as you top out on Easy Knot.

content.description:
This route has numerous good holds that makes the climbing look and feel easy in numerous places. About midway up, there is a large ledge with a madrone tree and an anchor if you wish to do the route in two pitches. From here, continue up to the top to finish the route. 

 The routes start was brushed in July of 2018, removing lots of the moss that made it more difficult
content.protection: Protected by 11 bolts. Anchor with chains
content.location: The route begins on the East Side of the Fire Dome. Walk towards the secret cleft, and the route begins about 5 feet to the left of a small overhang.

content.description: Access the top of the west wall of the Fire Dome just outside the Secrete Cleft. Begins with easy scrambling up jugs to a single bolt near the top protecting a single (5.6) move over the lip. Provides easy access to all top anchors of Fire Dome and the right side wall (looking up trail) of the Secret Cleft.
content.location: Climbs short wall just around the right corner as you emerge on the trail out the top of the Secret Cleft.

climbs.name: Double Jointed
climbs.fa: Greg Orton and Harold Hall, August 1998

content.description: A difficult start is aided by nice holds throughout the climb. This route is one of many in the area that are solid leads for a climber gaining experience with lead climbing. A set of rap rings about 2/3s of the way up makes toproping easier, but the actual route traverse to the right following the lip of the overhang where there is another set of anchors atop the small roof. From here, you can lead up a second pitch, and make it to the top. The second pitch is 5.6. Chains on summit. 30m rappel with 15m of air time.
content.protection: 6 bolts. Solid anchor with rap rings
content.location: Located on the North Face (Fire Dome) of the South Comb. It begins just to the left of the small area of shattered rock at the bottom in front of the face. It is very close to Mystic Monkey, so don't get them mixed up! See topo for reference

climbs.name: Candy Shop
climbs.fa: Harold Hall, Greg and Chandler Orton, 2002

content.description: A great warm up route for all climbers at Honeycombs. Lots of nice holds continuously up the face. At the start, a single bolt can stop your climber from taking a tumble down the hill, but once you get the second clip, you can undo the first one to reduce rope drag.
content.protection: Protected 9 bolts. Has anchor with chains and rap rings
content.location: Located at the North Face (Fire Dome) of the South Comb. It faces directly into the new clearing made by logging, so has easy access. See topo photo for reference.

content.description: Climbs straight up and through overhanging roof above. 5.6 to fist clip and then becomes progressively more difficult with each clip with a .10a finish over the overhang crack or 5.8 finish moving left at the overhang. Tops out at chain anchors on the ledge on top the overhang (top of first pitch to Double Jointed). Or, continue straight up to the summit on the second pitch to Double Jointed (5.6).
content.location: Between Candy Shop and Double Jointed. First clip just left of the faded 55+22 orange painted survey marking. Note that the glue-in bolts used on Burning Man are not as visible as the bolts + hangers used on Double Jointed.

content.description:
Immediately upon reaching South Comb, you will be staring at the face hosting Atrus Leap on the right side of the dark, solid slab. The left line, at 5.7, facilitates setting a TR and will provide a much happier rope-pulling experience after cleaning.

 The crux comes right out the gate, followed by easier movement. A first bolt that can be clipped from standing prevents any unplanned downhill excursions. The belayer may consider slinging themselves to to the madrone tree in order to focus on belaying.

 Once on top, do remember to turn around and admire the view.
content.protection: Protected by 10 bolts. Anchor with rap rings
content.location: As you walk to the South Comb, Atrus Leap is a bolted line that follows an arete on the right side of the South Comb. The belay area has been covered by recent logging and blasting, so the beginning of the climb is much different than it used to be. Some large boulders make for a nice spot to belay from though

content.description: Fire Dome is the North side of the South Comb. It consists of a variety of sport climbs, most of which are below 5.10. It extends from the road on the west side of the South Comb all the way up the west wall of the Secret Cleft on the east side of the South Comb.
